info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 7:39PM MDT until June 27 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Black Fire burn scar in... Northeastern Grant County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 1030 PM MDT. * At 739 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Black Fire Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in flash flooding in the Upper Mimbres and McKnight Canyon Basins. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Black Fire Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Black Fire Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Upper Mimbres Valley. Areas near NM Hwy 35 could experience flash flooding, especially low water crossings. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Black Fire Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
